step1.sentence: Don't be afraid to ask for help when you're struggling with the project.

step2.story: Maya stared at the broken sink for an hour, trying every YouTube tutorial she could find. Finally, she swallowed her pride and decided to ask for help from her neighbor, who turned out to be a retired plumber. Within ten minutes, the problem was fixed.

step3.story: On his first week at the new company, Jinho felt completely lost navigating the internal systems. He spent two full days trying to figure things out on his own, afraid that asking questions would make him look incompetent. By Wednesday, he had missed a deadline and his manager noticed. She sat down beside him and said, "There's no shame in asking for help — that's what the team is here for." Jinho finally opened up about what he was struggling with, and his colleagues guided him through everything in an afternoon. He realized that asking for help wasn't a weakness — it was the fastest way to grow.

meaning.realUsageKo: 혼자서 해결하기 어려운 상황에서 다른 사람에게 지원이나 조언을 구할 때 사용합니다. 일상 대화부터 업무 환경까지 폭넓게 쓰이는 기본 표현입니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'ask'(요청하다)와 'help'(도움)의 조합으로, 영어에서 가장 기본적이고 직접적인 도움 요청 표현입니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 격식 없이 누구에게나 자연스럽게 쓸 수 있는 중립적 표현입니다. 'ask for help'는 도움을 구하는 행위 자체를 강조하며, 겸손함이나 용기의 뉘앙스가 담길 수 있습니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: If you don't understand the instructions, just ask for help.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 설명이 이해가 안 되면 그냥 도움을 요청하세요.
